intro: Maianthemum canadense var. ovale, commonly known as the white false shamrock, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Convallariaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
